content: Within three months, Sabrina will independently grasp and release a soft ball in 4 out of 5 opportunities during structured play, to enhance fine motor strength and dexterity.
Within four months, Sabrina will crawl a distance of 10 feet on hands and knees with reciprocal movements across 4 out of 5 attempts, to improve gross motor coordination and explore her environment.
Within five months, Sabrina will visually track a moving object and reach for it with both hands in 4 out of 5 opportunities, enhancing visual-motor integration skills during play activities.
Within six months, Sabrina will bring her hands to midline and manipulate a toy held with both hands in 4 out of 5 opportunities, demonstrating improved bilateral coordination and midline crossing.
Within six months, Sabrina will drink from a sippy cup independently in 4 out of 5 opportunities, increasing her self-care and adaptive skills during mealtimes.
Within four months, Sabrina will tolerate tummy time with head control for 5 minutes without distress in 4 out of 5 attempts, supporting sensory processing and regulation.
Within five months, Sabrina will engage in shared drum-banging play with a caregiver for 3 minutes in 4 out of 5 opportunities, enhancing social participation and interactive play skills.
